title: The scene in Ecuador as protests and clashes erupt over President Moreno's austerity measures
text:
Ecuador has endured days of popular upheaval since President Lenín Moreno scrapped fuel price subsidies, a step that set off protests and clashes across the small South American country.

Oct. 8, 2019 Anti-government demonstrators gather in Quito, Ecuador, during clashes with the police as they protest President Lenín Moreno and his economic policies. Ecuador has endured days of popular upheaval since the president scrapped fuel price subsidies, a step that set off protests and clashes across the country. Fernando Vergara/AP
description: Ecuador has endured days of popular upheaval since President Lenín Moreno scrapped fuel price subsidies, a step that set off protests and clashes across the small South American country.
